qas.question: When did Roman Catholic Jesuits and Capuchins arrive in Tibet from Europe?
When did Portuguese missionaries first arrive in western Tibet?
When was Christianity introduced to Rudok, Ladakh, and Tsang?

plausible_answers.text: Jesuit Father António de Andrade and Brother Manuel Marques

qas.question: Who arrived in Western Tibet in 1642?
Where did Father Antonio de Andrade and Brother Manuel Marques first reach in 1642?
How many converts were there by 1672?

context: Roman Catholic Jesuits and Capuchins arrived from Europe in the <a0_0>17th and 18th centuries<a0_0/>. Portuguese missionaries <b3_0>Jesuit Father António de Andrade and Brother Manuel Marques<b3_0/> first reached <b4_0>the kingdom of Gelu<b4_0/> in western Tibet in <a1_0>1624<a1_0/> and was welcomed by the royal family who allowed them to build a church later on. By 1627, there were <b5_0>about a hundred<b5_0/> local converts in the Guge kingdom. Later on, Christianity was introduced to Rudok, Ladakh and Tsang and was welcomed by the ruler of the Tsang kingdom, where Andrade and his fellows established <b6_0>a Jesuit outpost<b6_0/> at Shigatse in <a2_0>1626<a2_0/>.
